intro: Globba crispa, commonly known as the crested globba, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Globba crispa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique floral structure. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade in tropical and subtropical climates.
